title: brieFly â€“ AI Meeting Insight Extractor
description: A GenAI-powered assistant built using OpenAI Whisper, GPT-4o, and RoBERTa to provide end-to-end meeting intelligence from audio input.
points: Transcribes meeting audio using OpenAI Whisper and summarizes key points and action items with GPT-4o.
Detects the emotional tone of meetings using RoBERTa sentiment classification model.
Integrates Zoom API to fetch user meeting recordings directly from the cloud.
Generates personalized suggestions for team managers to promote emotional well-being and team productivity.

title: Differentially-Private Image Classifier
description: This project focuses on implementing Differentially Private Stochastic Gradient Descent (DP-SGD) using Opacus, incorporating:
points: Adaptive Gradient Clipping and Weight Standardization to enhance privacy-utility trade-offs.
Optimization of ResNet-20 and WRN-16-4 for image classification on the CIFAR-10 dataset
Achieved best accuracy 63% accuracy under privacy constraints, approaching the state-of-the-art benchmark of 70%

title: CollabPal - Collaborative Tools for Group Projects on EdTech Platforms
domain: User Experience Design | User Research | Design Principles
description: As part of the Human Computer Interaction course in my Master's program, this project involves extensive user research leading to a high-fidelity protoype for the lack of user-friendly tools to assist group assignments and projects on edTech platforms.
points: Developed a smart platform that suggests appropriate tools based on the project and course.
Integrated a calendar feature that tracks group members' schedules and suggests feasible meeting times.

title: Tenzies - The Game
description: React-based dice game demonstrating state, props, and conditional rendering.
points: Built with reusable components and effective prop/state usage.
Used useState and useEffect for state handling and side effects.

title: Building Sustainable Transportation Solutions for Large Campuses
description: Vast campuses pose commuting challenges due to their size, discouraging walking and aggravating pollution and parking issues. This project developed as part of my internship at BOSCH streamlined on-campus transportation system. Users book two-wheelers through an Android , while admins manage assets and track usage through a backend database and mobile app.
points: Raspberry Pi used to simulate docking station.

title: My Staff Room
description: Android app for faculty to exchange messages and documents.
points: Supports text, images, PDFs, DOCX for academic communication.
Secured with Firebase OAuth authentication and database.
